website_summaries.verdict: Ties together many of the options solo hikers crave, like a roomy vestibule and ability to strip to minimal weight, with luxury extras.
pros: Backpackers can opt for a minimalist setup
Lots of detailed extras like a mesh pocket and light clip
The included footprint with built-in inflatable layer is a nice bonus
cons: Those over 6 feet tall will be very cramped inside this tent

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my purposes.
customer_reviews.text: It packs down so small that i take it will me on all of my flights overseas in my carry on (i never check in luggage). its my backup for the times i cant find a place to stay. and the price is so reasonable that i wouldnt cry if authorities took it away or it simply got lost. i have another tent that packs down smaller, but its more expensive, so i dont take it with me on vacation. i keep it for camping near home or in my bob when not camping.

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Tent!
customer_reviews.text: The first night I used it a very strong front came through with torrential downpours and incredible wind gusts. I thought I was going the way of Dorothy's house in the Wizard of Oz's house. Not only did the tent perform flawlessly, I stayed 100% dry. The photos were taken up at the Guyot Campsite 11 miles into the Pemigewasset Wilderness in the White Mountains of New Hampshire. As you can see you don't have much extra room for a card table or anything like that. The tent is easy to set up and take down too. The stretch cord in the pools pulls the pieces together in seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard D Kierstead

customer_reviews.title: This is totally worth the super price if you can't afford the crazy high end ...
customer_reviews.text: This is totally worth the super price if you can't afford the crazy high end ultra light backpacking one....stargazing is great with this one as well!
customer_reviews.author: Mishelle an hoffman-wentz

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I pair this with a one man hammock for camping in the summer time. Cheap and durable for the price. Super lightweight, when I received it in the mail I couldn't tell what it was until I had opened it up.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah

customer_reviews.title: Stuff sack to small
customer_reviews.text: Tent worked well on bicycle camping trip. It was easy to put up and light enough for taking on bicycle trip. I could sit up in it which was nice. The only complaint is that once tent is removed from stuff sack I could not get it completely back in. Will look for a slightly larger stuff sack.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Not 100% waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I like the ease of setting up the tent, the weight, and the included waterproof footprint. I was surprised that the tent itself is not completely waterproof. I was camped in a huge thunderstorm. When the huge rain drops hit the tent, the fabric dissipated the water into a fine mist inside the tent. I used my poncho to keep my sleeping bag dry. The bathtub and footprint were 100% waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Haggisguy

customer_reviews.title: I see easy to set up hold up well and it didn’t rain inside the tent
customer_reviews.text: Spent two weeks out in this tent. I was easy to set up held up well and it didn’t rain inside the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Dirt

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about it
customer_reviews.text: I was able to try this tent in rainy weather and unfortunately on the 4th night the water was dripping slowly thru where the joining section, I just put a duck tape over and was ok. I was only hiking for a week, so not sure if this tent would be good for more rainy nights.
customer_reviews.author: Ivi

customer_reviews.title: Multi Optional Quality On the Trail
customer_reviews.text: This tent is awesome and comes with two options. Shed some weight and take the rainfly, poles, and foot print on the trail and have a shelter or take it all and sleep comfy under the stars. For the price this tent is great.
customer_reviews.author: MORETTI OUTDOORS

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: The tent was easy to set up and had the right amount of room for me. The tent also held up nicely and didn't crash at night when there was wind. In addition the net blocked the entrance so, no mosquito's could get in which is helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff L.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I used this tent on my first attempt at hiking the PCT! And it held up better then all the really expensive backpacking company tents out there!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Condit

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, easy to mount
customer_reviews.text: The tent is lightweight, the package is small, and it's easy to mount. I like the versatility, so that you can use only the inner tent/mosquito fly, or only the footprint and rainfly, or both. It does need to be aired before use, the smell of the new tent is really strong.
customer_reviews.author: Lotta

customer_reviews.title: No useable directions.
customer_reviews.text: Some actual directions on how to put this up would have been great.
customer_reviews.author: roberta markevitch

customer_reviews.title: Thoughtfully designed.
customer_reviews.text: Neat tent. Very well designed. Poles snap together on their own and the ground cloth is a nice add. Also - the inside height makes it easy to sit up in. Very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Amacker

customer_reviews.title: Nice and light
customer_reviews.text: Nice and light. However if you’re tall like myself, 6’, there will not be room for you and your backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for one person.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and easy to setup. Plenty of room for a single person. The vestibule could be larger but was plenty big for my purposes. Had quality light weight stakes and plenty of tie downs for the rain fly.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Really nice design
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected. Probably too small for tall people. Feels cheap but that is likely for weight savings.
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: I am using this tent for a Thru hike of the Appalachian Trail and it is perfect. Easy to set up and the minimalist pitch option is great if it gets too hot.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just a little on the short side if you are over 6’ don’t use this tent
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Rain fly works well. It does collect a lot of dew on the inside of the rain fly, which then can drip through the upper tent mesh.
customer_reviews.author: James Richter

customer_reviews.title: great one man tent plenty of room
customer_reviews.text: It was very simple and worked well even in snow. No moisture problem. Stayed dry in my down bag.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia E

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice light weight tent. Can't wait to use it on my 50 mile hike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken zipper
customer_reviews.text: Zipper broke second time out camping. Will update depending on manufacturer response.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Luxe Tempo 3.3LB 1 Person Backpacking Tent Solo with Free Footprint Minimalist Pitch Option
feature_bullets: Design--Luxe Tempo's strategic clip placement and pole set creates vertical walls and no-drip entry way ,greatly enhances room for head,shoulder and foot but still ensures a light weight for backpacking;The INNOVATIVE BENT POINTS placement of the poles creates 2 slightly sloped surface to help rain and snow to slide off

Material--Rip-stop reinforced taffeta Full-length fly (210T) with all seams taped features 3000mm polyurethane coating and provide excellent protection from heavy rain;No-see-um mesh inner tent ensures wonderful ventilation and starry night view without biting pests

Detailing--Mesh pocket over the head keep small items organized and accessible when lying down,Guy out points on the top directly act upon the pole when guy lined to secure the tent in high wind ;Gusseted tent corner to sustain constant tension;Anti-Grit reversed SBS zipper to prevent clogging;2 ceiling loops for lamp

Save weight and create a minimalist shelter--You can buckle the footprint to the fly to creat an instant ultralight shlter , or clip inner tent under the fly if you need to set up in rain,you can also move the tent with footprint in one piece if you need to change camp place thanks to this feature

Dimensions Measurements(Taken fromm grommet to grommet):Length:82.6 in.,shoulder length:37.4 in.,foot length:20.5 in. peak height:41.3 in.;Packed Weight(everything included):3.8lbs,Trail Weight(without accessories):3.3lb;Footprint Included in Package for free.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
